reviewText: I'm glad I had the foresight to tape this wonderful production when it was originally shown on CBS as a Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation. William Faulkner's tale of loss, love and redemption was very well served by Horton Foote's sensitive adaptation, a splendid cast, fine direction and some wonderfully atmospheric location cinematography. Faulkner can be very hard to understand in any medium, but I think even he would have been satisfied with this fine translation. His story has been well served by this medium.My only complaint: Why is this award-winning film not available on DVD? IMO it should be. Among the many obvious reasons why is a brand new one: Horton Foote passed away today (WED/04MAR09) at age 92. Preserving this film in a hardier and more accessible format would be a fitting tribute to his memory and would add luster to his better-known film adaptations (To Kill a Mockingbird, etc.) and original screenwriting credits (The Trip to Bountiful, Tender Mercies, etc.).Dear Amazon: Please provide a DVD request box on this page for this purpose. Thanks.

reviewText: The Collectors Edition has an extra feature about the making of the movie.  It does not have the promotional trailers which precede the movie on this edition.  (What counts most, of course, is the condition of the individual VHS tape.  We bought one of each edition and both tapes play well.)Now for the movie itself.The Convict and the woman he rescues pass through a series of adventures.  As we watched we were sometimes struck with quiet awe, sometimes with laughter, finally with delight. What a trip!  The rich setting, the effective photography, the quiet story of their relationship, the variety of scenes and characters, the acting -- "Old Man" is a winner on every count.  I treasure the memory of the convict.More than most Hallmark films I know, it is built on a solid ethical foundation.All that's is lacking is a DVD edition for North America.  The sound won recognition, so I suppose it is first rate, but our old VHS player only puts out mono.  DVD please?  Pretty please?
summary: Check out the Collectors Edition of the same Hallmark movie

reviewText: This is a definite must see movie! I highly recommend it, and  I wished that this wonderful movie, was on DVD!A group of prisoners that are part of a work force, is sent to help the people that are stranded, during the big flood of the Mississippi River. While on a boat, one of the prisoners gets lost from the others, and ends up helping a beautiful, but very pregnant woman (Addie), that's sitting in a tree.The two become friends, and end up falling in love, but never declaring it to each other. Addie realizes early on, that the prisoner who rescued her, is a honorable, good man, and he has the best time of his life with Addie!But he knows that when he locates the prison work force, that he belongs to, that he must make a decison on either, to stay with Addie, or finish serving his time, so that he can be a free man. I simply loved this movie very much! It is a different, wonderful, awesome, love story! MOVIE IDEA: Movie people, please make a sequel to OLD MAN!
